title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 06 June 2012 - XWiki
content:
00:06 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
00:18 <ssavi> has quit  
00:19 <ssavi> has joined #xwiki  
00:25 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:26 <ssavi> polx: Hi  
01:02 <polx> has quit  
01:02 <ssavi> has left #xwiki  
01:21 <jamie\_\_wiki> cjd:  I've updated XWIKI-7874 with a pull request that implements a fix, based off xwiki-platform-3.5.  Cheers.  
01:22 <@cjd> thanks, I'll take a look  
01:23 <jamie\_\_wiki> Now people can link to attachments on those pages again in my install  :)  Thanks.  
01:53 <CIA-117> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* reb9fcd7 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/eb9fcd7726986f1a1dbf93ccbbac542093a48868 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/historyinline.vm : XWIKI-7882: Delete a selected history range of multilingual pages does not work - http://git.io/QVdPxA  
01:54 <@sdumitriu> cjd: What's the status of the stable-4.1.x branch? Commits in that branch will end up in 4.1-rc-1 or is that one already in staging?  
01:55 <CIA-117> Sergiu Dumitriu stable-4.1.x \* r62c8b74 https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/62c8b74a09cb0b8bf8d7fdf2704963880b2137c1 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-web/src/main/webapp/templates/historyinline.vm : XWIKI-7882: Delete a selected history range of multilingual pages does not work - http://git.io/806LGQ  
02:02 <@cjd> commits to that branch will end up in rc1

05:08 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
06:50 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <Denis1> has joined #xwiki  
07:03 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
07:06 <Denis> has quit  
07:46 <polx> Saavi: hi,  
07:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
07:56 <mflorea> has quit  
07:57 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:27 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:30 <polx> ssavi, Hi  
08:31 <ssavi> polx: Hi..  
08:31 <ssavi> http://dl.dropbox.com/u/2027256/apidocs/index.html  
08:31 <ssavi> here is the link to the API...  
08:31 <polx> thanks, that's easier  
08:31 <ssavi> :)  
08:32 <ssavi> I'l update the link in the design page too  
08:32 <polx> So... no lucene/solr query yet?  
08:32 <polx> oh, sorry, there is  
08:33 <polx> no, there is none with search(Query)  
08:33 <polx> also, returning SolrQuery is likely to add a dependency that is not desired, I'd return object and let the java-devs cast as needed and the others happily auto-cast.  
08:34 <ssavi> I actually thought about that.. Will change the to object  
08:35 <polx> class-loading dependencies are quite evil sometimes!  
08:35 <polx> why are IndexerProcess getEstimatedCompletionTime and getIndexingSpeed return String?  
08:35 <polx> They could all speak in miliseconds as long or? Or as Date and long?  
08:36 <polx> SearchResult, you still have to do then?  
08:36 <polx> Btw, a zip attachment in xwiki can have its parts served... that might be another way to publish  
08:36 <tekzilla> has quit  
08:37 <polx> You'd attached the zip then refer to the parts as ..../xwiki/download/Space/Name/archive.zip/index.html for example.  
08:37 <ssavi> oh .. .k..  
08:38 <polx> getEndIndex... I wonder if this should not be getPageEndIndex, just as getPagePreviousIndex, getPageNextIndex etc.  
08:38 <ssavi> I'll have the respective data types instead of string in Indexer process?  
08:38 <polx> Makes sense to me.  
08:38 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
08:39 <polx> Why does SearchResult have no method?  
08:40 <ssavi> The searchresult will have the fieldtype of the document..  
08:41 <ssavi> and the get methods for it  
08:41 <ssavi> have to include them.  
08:42 <ssavi> something like this  
08:42 <ssavi> private String id;  
08:42 <ssavi>  private float score;  
08:42 <ssavi>  private String title;  
08:43 <ssavi>  public String getId()  
08:43 <ssavi>     {  
08:43 <ssavi>         return this.id;  
08:43 <ssavi>     }  
08:44 <polx> sounds good  
08:44 <polx> though... fieldtype?? would you copy all of that?  
08:44 <polx> I'd just make getters that pull from the solr stored fields.  
08:48 <ssavi> Then I guess I don't need that class  
08:49 <ssavi> I''m collecting large dataset from wikipedia and importing it to XWiki  
08:49 <ssavi> for indexing..  
08:50 <polx> You definitely do!@  
08:50 <polx> that's a cool idea for a scalability challenge.  
08:51 <ssavi> planning to use them to come up with IndexerProcess Implementaion  
08:51 <ssavi> yeah..  
08:51 <polx> Using that class as an abstraction to the documents of solr or lucene is really really useful.  
08:51 <polx> do you have a hosting for that?  
08:51 <ssavi> I didn't get you sorry  
08:51 <polx> something such as public Object get(fieldName)  
08:53 <polx> or  
08:53 <polx> public Object getValue(fieldName)  
08:53 <polx> public List getValues(fieldName)  
08:53 <polx> is going to allow people to easily pull the values stored in solr and avoid to wait for the xwiki loading. This is a huge performance boost!  
08:53 <polx> also, where would highlighting be coming from?  
08:54 <polx> Btw, some search methods (the one with the query?) should support a list of returned fields. Crucial for performance as well.  
08:54 <polx> (e.g. in most cases, you do not want the "description" field, and you want to avoid to load it, but for some queries, it actually makes sense)  
08:56 <ssavi> for searchResult class I was thinking of making use of the getters that pull the stored fields from the solrdocument and assign it to the member variables.. (happens in constructor)  
08:58 <polx> That's an extra potentially useless pull step.  
08:58 <polx> Solr (and Lucene) has the notion of lazy-loaded fields and this would nullify this feature. Even though people would not indicate the fields they intend to use (maybe because they just want to search through a simple text), they are likely to never pull most of the stored fields.  
08:58 <polx> The too-many-stored fields that are read always is the biggest issue of the Lucene plugin of xwiki.  
09:02 <vmassol> has quit  
09:05 <ssavi> Yeah I'll keep that in mind..  
09:05 <ssavi> I have doubt in Index process  
09:06 <ssavi> I'm quite confused on when to start indexing  
09:06 <ssavi> is it on the start of XWiki server or is it human triggered?  
09:08 <ssavi> polx: I also went through solaritas  
09:09 <ssavi> The page tool doesn't have much in it except for few properties like results per page, results found, page count, current page no..  
09:10 <ssavi> Am I missing something here?  
09:20 <polx> this pagetool is just the nifty thing to avoid doing horrible view computations.  
09:21 <polx> (sorry, I was away on, finally, a successful plug of hypericHQ!)  
09:21 <polx> When to start indexing...  
09:22 <polx> I think there several situations:  
09:22 <polx> - incremental updates: this you want always  
09:22 <polx> - empty/broken index: not sure  
09:22 <polx> - manual reindex (e.g. change of schema.xml): human triggered  
09:31 <ssavi> .k... I'l come up with set of overloaded methods for start index  
09:33 <polx> I think you need to design this with an admin interface in the head.  
09:33 <polx> I tend to feel that these kind of things should be file based... but you sure could use objects to configure.  
09:42 <ssavi> I'll modify the API with the suggestions you gave  
09:42 <ssavi> polx: Thanks a lot :)  
09:42 <CIA-117> Sergiu Dumitriu master \* rdcf57fb https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/dcf57fb50f988f24e99373b3baafdc05494002a7 / xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-oldcore/src/main/java/com/xpn/xwiki/render/ListSubstitution.java : [misc] Improved performance, reduced usage of Apache Oro - http://git.io/yum4pQ  
09:50 <polx> ssavi, you're welcome. I am sorry I am bit irregularly look at the IRC channel.  
09:50 <ssavi> polx: I understand. Not a problem at all  
10:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

13:38 <vmassol> indeed, guillaume from infra is looking at it

13:40 <vmassol> (unfortunately I'm busy today so I have stashed your commits for review later on - hope some other committers can review too)  
13:40 <vmassol> nice issues you picked  
13:44 <+AndreasJonsson> Its actually a national holiday today.  But the rain is pouring down...  
13:44 <vmassol> nice :)  
13:50 <vmassol> solved  
13:50 <Inge-> Andreas must be in Sweden :)  
13:50 <vmassol> it was the old git plugin that was messing up the AS  
13:50 <Inge-> Hipp hipp Hurra :)  
13:50 <vmassol> the good news  
13:50 <vmassol> is that the new DVCS plugin works now (the Commit tab) :)

18:18 <ssavi> sdumitriu: Hi  
18:20 <ssavi> Am trying to create pages using XMLRPC, but it throws exception when I use long strings for content. Is there a way to increase the size?  
18:20 <ssavi> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Features/XMLRPC

18:33 <+tmortagne> ssavi: you really need to use XML RPC ? using REST is generally better  
18:33 <+tmortagne> XMLRPC is more or less deprecated  
18:34 <+tmortagne> I mean the XWiki XMLRPC interface  
18:34 <+tmortagne> we mostly work on REST now  
18:38 <polx> has joined #xwiki
